data.name: Rosenkov Snaring Gauntlets
data.flavor: Arm pieces that were designed with trench warfare in mind, they have strong electromagnets that prove especially useful when regulated by combat computers.
data.mechanic: You are immune to dropping your weapon if hit by any effect that would otherwise disarm you.

data.name: Elanus Goliath Gauntlets
data.flavor: Arm plating with micro servos that coordinate muscle movements when resistance is encountered.
data.mechanic: Advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.

data.name: Batarian Talon Gauntlets
data.flavor: A set of spiked, clawed gauntlets that give the appearance of their wearer possessing demonic hands.
data.mechanic: Add 1 point of Slashing damage to all melee damage rolls. Advantage on Intimidation skill checks.

data.name: Serrice Adaptor Gauntlets
data.flavor: A pair of gauntlets that have micro fabricators in their frames. These can spread omnigel through the rest of the hardsuit, inuring the combatant to a type of damage.
data.mechanic: Every long rest, you can designate a type of damage (fire, necrotic, poison, etc.) and gain resistance to it until you take another long rest.

data.name: GUARDIAN Gauntlets
data.flavor: Arm gauntlets that contain power cells that fuel a miniature version of a starship's standard GARDIAN point defense lasers.
data.mechanic: When you are targeted by a heavy weapon that relies on a projectile (i.e. Hydra rockets, a Cain missile, etc.) as opposed to a Directed Energy Weapon, you may use your reaction once per long rest to target any of the projectiles with your GUARDIAN and shoot it out of the sky, reducing its damage to 0. Recharges after a long rest.

data.name: Predator Armor
data.flavor: Standard issue armor for Turian infantry. The interlocking plates provide increased protection against potentially fatal wounds.
data.mechanic: Increase thermal clip capacity by 4. Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit/

data.name: Colossus Armor
data.flavor: The Colossus armor is one of the finest entry-level armor suits available.
data.mechanic: +5 shield points. Increase shield regen by 1 die type.

data.name: Mercenary Armor
data.flavor: Basic armor offering a minor upgrade to shield capacitors.
data.mechanic: +5 shields points.

data.name: BT Suit
data.flavor: Equipped with a full battle telemetry system to increase Omni-tool power efficiency.
data.mechanic: Increase tech regen die by one die type.

data.name: Asari Initiate Armor
data.flavor: Standard issue armor for all Asari infantry. Build-in biotic amps provide a minor boost to biotic powers.
data.mechanic: While wearing this armor, your cantrips are considered to be 1 step higher in their progression. For example, a 1st level player casts a cantrip as if they were at the 5th level. 5th -> 11th. 11th -> 17th. There is no additional effect at the 17th level.

data.name: Mantis Armor
data.flavor: Hahne-Kedar's line of armor that utilizes auxiliary power cells that feed into wearer's weapons.
data.mechanic: +2 to ranged attack damage

data.name: Rosenkov Reflex Armor
data.flavor: Sturdy armor that gathers real-time battle telemetry, and whose on-board combat computer can help a combatant move faster than they can think.
data.mechanic: Once per short rest, you may take 2 reactions within a single turn.

data.name: Hahne-Kedar Tactical Armor
data.flavor: A chestplate that disperses weight in a way that makes carrying more equipment bearable.
data.mechanic: When wearing this armor, treat your Strength ability score as if it were 19 for the purposes of carrying equipment (unless your score is higher, then no effect occurs).

data.name: Sirta Parade Armor
data.flavor: Glossy armor that shines in the light, designed to look good as its first function.
data.mechanic: Advantage on Persuasion and Performance checks.

data.name: Serrice Rimebane Armor
data.flavor: Chest plating with auxiliary power cells that defrost spots of crystalline ice caused by cryo rounds on impact.
data.mechanic: Immune to Frozen condition.

data.name: Cerberus Assault Armor
data.flavor: Cerberus assault armor is designed for shock troops, who are expected to turn the tide of battle against creatures or forces that would decimate normal soldiers. The troops demanded three things in its design: shields and armor thick enough to last against a superior foe, and compartments for extra thermal clips. The only drawback of the armor is its weight, which the troops carry as a point of pride. They have a saying: "Out of shape going in, in shape coming out."
data.mechanic: +30 shield points. +2 AC. Increase your thermal clip capacity by 4.

data.name: Collector Armor
data.flavor: The Collectors' chitinous armor is flexible and even tougher than ballistic fibers. Its organic construction allows it to be self-healing, and the muscle-like tissue that assists movement ensures it is comfortable to wear despite its weight. This suit was originally adapted out of salvaged Collector technology by Cerberus, and is incredibly difficult to find on the galactic market.
data.mechanic: +50 shield points. Increase shield regen by 3 die types. Gain additional hit points equal to twice your level.

data.name: N7 Defender Armor
data.flavor: The Defender Armor is a variation on the N7 Special Forces’ combat gear, built to protect soldiers in long-running engagements where reinforcements may be sparse. When the wearer fires a weapon, the suit's computers divert energy from the main power cell to the gun's kinetic coils, offering an extra punch. The Defender's storage compartments are designed to hold spare thermal clips, while capacitors throughout the armor provide extra power to shields during critical moments in battle. The armor also comes with an injection system built into the suit and neural-linked bio-monitors that help adjust the wearer's breathing rate and adrenaline levels.
data.mechanic: +10 shield points. Gain additional hit points equal to your level. +2 bonus to ranged weapon attack and damage rolls. Increase thermal clip capacity by 4.

data.name: Terminus Assault Armor
data.flavor: The Terminus Armor is environmentally sealed with an independent air supply for use in space and extreme planetary conditions. Its on onboard microframe computer runs a suite of battle management software. To prevent detection by passive thermal sensors, body heat is channeled to the base of the feet and dispersed into the ground.
data.mechanic: +10 shield points. Increase thermal clip capacity by 4. +2 bonus to melee attack and damage rolls

data.name: Warlord Armor
data.flavor: A favorite for Krogran gladiators. The armor is finished with a silver polish, which quickly becomes dented, scuffed, and bloodied. These "battle scars" tell the tale of a Krogan's feats.
data.mechanic: Resistance to slashing and bludgeoning damage.

data.name: Cerberus Nightmare Armor
data.flavor: Nightmare armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms expecting long-range conflicts. Powerful capacitors deliver punishing energy to the Phantom's weapons, and circulating coolant in its gloves allows for more shots before a given thermal clip overheats. The remaining energy focuses on shield strength and regeneration time to help survivability.
data.mechanic: +10 shield points. Increase shield regen die by 1 die type. Increase your thermal clip capacity by 8. Equipped weapons have their heat increased by 2. +2 bonus to ranged weapon attack and damage rolls.

data.name: Cerberus Spirit Armor
data.flavor: Spirit armor is worn by Cerberus Phantoms fortunate enough to be biotic or for those who are skilled enough to use highly technical attacks. The armor has small gains for shield strength and regeneration, but where it truly shines is in its capacity to amplify biotic amps and omni-tools. These attacks hit significantly harder and more often, allowing the Phantom to dismantle heavily-armored targets.
data.mechanic: Increase shield regen by 1 die type. +5 bonus to ranged biotic or tech attack and damage rolls. Regain one 3rd-level or lower spell slot on a short rest. Increase your tech regen die by 2 die type.

data.name: Blood Dragon Armor
data.flavor: Originally created for Earth's Urban Combat Championship league, this set of armor has undergone as much or more field testing than those of modern militaries. It uses a unique, proprietary power cell that costs as much as a EUCC rookie's contract. The armor's microframe computer adapts to any top-tier omni-tool, kinetic barrier, or biotic amp, giving breathtaking and error-free performance. The chest and shoulder piece bears the logo of the Edmonton Blood Dragons, and the inside of the armor bears the signatures of the entire team.
data.mechanic: +20 shield points. +3 bonus to biotic or tech attack and damage rolls. Regain one 3rd-level or lower spell slot on a short rest. Increase your tech regen die by 1 die type.

data.name: Cerberus Ajax Armor
data.flavor: Among Cerberus soldiers, Ajax armor is favored by those brave or unlucky enough to lead charges to break enemy formations. Its role is to keep the wearer standing and shooting as long as possible. It offers some benefit to omni-tool and biotic amp systems, but its main emphasis is boosting and recharging its kinetic barrier and bleeding off weapon heat through coolant circulation in its gloves.
data.mechanic: +30 shield points. Increase your shield regen die by two die types. Increase your thermal clip capacity by 12. Equipped weapons have their heat increased by 2.

data.name: Cerberus Shade Armor
data.flavor: The Terminus Armor is environmentally sealed with an independent air supply for use in space and extreme planetary conditions. Its onboard microframe computer runs a suite of battle management software. To prevent detection by passive thermal sensors, body heat is channeled to the base of the feet and dispersed into the ground.
data.mechanic: +10 shield points. Increase shield regen die by 1 die type. Increase your thermal clip capacity by 4. +2 bonus to all attack and damage rolls.

data.name: Inferno Armor
data.flavor: Built specifically for Cerberus field officers, the Inferno armor has a VI dedicated to recognizing signs of stress and medical trauma. This application helps assess soldiers, but can be useful in any high risk situations. The Inferno's microframe computer also manages biotic amp and omni-tool power, and microservos help the wearer's movements to counteract the armor's weight.
data.mechanic: When you expend a medigel charge, add an additional hit die to your roll. +2 bonus to biotic and tech attack and damage rolls. Regain one 2nd-level or lower spell slot on a short rest. Increase your tech regen die by 1 die type.

data.name: Reckoner Knight Armor
data.flavor: The Reckoner-Knight armor was originally worn by the winners of Earth's Urban Combat Championship 2186, the Rhode Island Knights. A military-grade version of this equipment was presented to longtime Knight fans at the Alliance's Rhode Island base, in thanks for their passionate (and vocal) support during the EUCC championship matches. Beneath this armor's medieval-gothic facade lie a host of biofeedback systems intended to monitor the wearer's health and combat performance. Micro-servos maximize damage done in close-quarters combat, while a beefed-up power cell feeds energy into weapons systems to increase projectile velocity. Befitting gear originally designed for a full-contact sport, a sophisticated shield system also offers the wearer solid protection from incoming attacks.
data.mechanic: +10 shield points. Gain additional hit points equal to twice your level. +2 to ranged weapon damage rolls. +5 bonus to melee attack rolls. When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

data.name: Partisan Armor
data.flavor: Batarian State Arms developed a line of armor meant to protect Batarian soldiers for alien diseases and infections.
data.mechanic: Advantage on Constitution saving throws that would the {poisoned} status.

data.name: N7 Armor
data.flavor: Standard issue armor for all Alliance infantry.
data.mechanic: Gain additional hit points equal to your level.

data.name: Hermetic Suit Plating
data.flavor: Specifically designed for Quarians to protect their suit from puncture damage.
data.mechanic: +1 AC

data.name: Kestrel Helmet
data.flavor: The Kestrel armor system's helmet forgoes traditional transparent visors in favor of a reinforced faceplate with an internal heads-up display. The display connects to redundant micro cameras to allow naturalistic vision inside the well-padded interior.
data.mechanic: +2 AC

data.name: Securitel Helmet
data.flavor: The Securitel Helmet was originally designed as riot-gear. It is covered in ablative plating, well-padded to lessen damage from shocks, blows and bullet impacts. The helmet's emitters boost shielding in the rest of the armor, while its onboard computers monitor the wearer's heart-rate and central nervous system.
data.mechanic: +10 shield points. When you would take piercing, bludgeoning, slashing, or lightening damage, roll 1d4 and reduce the damage by that amount.

data.name: Kuwashii Visor
data.flavor: Developed by Ariake Technologies, the wearer exchanges full protective coverage for visibility, unencumbered mobility, and increased accuracy.
data.mechanic: -1 AC, +2 bonus to ranged weapon attack roll and damage rolls

data.name: Sentry Interface
data.flavor: This visor works with the Sentry system, a software application that optimizes an armor suit's microframe computer. When the Sentry system is running, more power can be devoted to shield management.
data.mechanic: -1 AC. Your shields recharge every turn despite taking damage.

data.name: Archon Visor
data.flavor: The Archon visor uses an efficiency algorithm to balance processing power for omni-tools. A heads-up display and voice command software allows users to micromanage the systems, reducing the cool-down period between energy expenditures.
data.mechanic: -1 AC. Gain additional tech points equal to your level.

data.name: Umbra Visor
data.flavor: A next-generation night-vision device that assists targeting. By detecting the focal point of the wearer's eyes and enhancing the image at that location, the visor helps direct a biotic power or a shot from an omni-tool exactly where the wearer is looking.
data.mechanic: -1 AC. When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a biotic spell or tech power, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

data.name: Mnemonic Visor
data.flavor: Relatively new to the market, the Mnemonic Visor is difficult to find outside Alliance space. Intended for biotic specialists, this headpiece plugs into the rest of the user's suit, gathering data so it can adapt to the wearer's tactics. It boosts biotic performance at critical moments to allow a soldier to perform with greater power than normally possible.
data.mechanic: -1 AC. While wearing this helmet, you may choose one 2nd-level or lower spell you know. This spell is always cast at one level higher than the spell slot you use to cast it (e.g. 3rd-level for a 2nd-level spell slot). If you have advanced the spell, you may choose either advancement when you cast it. You may spend 8 hours retooling the helmet and choose a different spell.

data.name: Delumcore Overlay
data.flavor: Developed by Delumcore Systems, a VI inside this headgear enhances aim when targeting an enemy's vulnerable points. It also maximizes armor-cell efficiency, feeding excess power to weapon systems.
data.mechanic: -1 AC. While wearing this helmet, all ranged weapons roll critical hits on 19-20. This does not stack with any other feature that reduces critical hit threshold.

data.name: Death Mask
data.flavor: Developed by Tyriel Advanced Communications Corporation (TACC), the latest version of the Death Mask offers exceptional protection and real-time data feedback that helps coordinate the wearer's melee attacks.
data.mechanic: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

data.name: Capacitor Helmet
data.flavor: A recent design, this Alliance-made helmet stores micro capacitors in its structure to replenish spent kinetic barriers. The transpari-plast armor panel on its top can be removed to access capacitors for field maintenance.
data.mechanic: Increase your shield regen die by one die type.

data.name: Recon Hood
data.flavor: A hood issued to covert action teams, this model's optic display interfaces with most small arm's auto-targeting software, linking hand and eye for improved accuracy and increased weapon damage. Ballistic-mesh fabric and composite ceramic plating provide necessary armor, and the integral air filter helps in hostile environments.
data.mechanic: When you roll a critical hit, add and additional damage die to your roll.

data.name: Lockdown Greaves
data.flavor: A pair of leg armor pieces that connect the wearer's boots to the suit's power supply, turning the boots into a powerful electromagnet.
data.mechanic: As a bonus action, the wearer can activate the effect of the greaves to stick to the surface they are walking on, provided it's made of metal. This can aid them in walking up walls, upside down, etc. This lasts for 1 minute, and gives the user advantage to resist effects that lift or move them while under this armor's effects.

data.name: Stealth Greaves
data.flavor: Greaves that secrete a highly advanced lubricant in the joints.
data.mechanic: While you wear these greaves, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on Stealth checks that rely on moving silently.

data.name: Enviro-Greaves
data.flavor: A set of leg armor that makes the user much more maneuverable in a mountainous or aquatic environment with normally unsuitable terrain.
data.mechanic: Advantage on Athletics checks made to swim or climb.

data.name: Strider Legguards
data.flavor: Greaves that use a set of mass effect field generators to alter the wearer's gravity, making certain maneuvers much more manageable.
data.mechanic: Advantage on Acrobatics checks and Dexterity checks and saving throws.

data.name: Power Reservoir Legguards
data.flavor: A set of greaves that have batteries designed to conserve biotic power.
data.mechanic: As a reaction, restore all barrier ticks. You may use this ability once per long rest.

data.name: Stock Light Armor
data.flavor: A cheap and simple set of light armor.

data.name: Stock Medium Armor
data.flavor: A cheap and simple set of medium armor.

data.name: Stock Heavy Armor
data.flavor: A cheap and simple set of heavy armor.
